wikipedia_page.main: John Norman Bateman-Champain (14 March 1880 – 22 October 1950) was a first-class English cricketer, making five appearances for Gloucestershire, who later in life became the third Anglican Bishop suffragan of Knaresborough. Bateman-Champain was a right-handed batsman.
